justification: "The five-item Personal Relative Deprivation Scale, Revised (PRDS-R) assesses feelings of deprivation, resentment, and anger … We adapted the scale to specifically reference group members."

measured_by: single-item question: "To what extent do you feel that you were competing with the other group members?"
justification: "Participants indicated agreement with … (2) ‘To what extent do you feel that you were competing with the other group members?’. Each item was investigated separately."

measured_by: single-item statement: "There was an imbalance of power in the group"
justification: "Participants indicated agreement with the following statements/questions: (1) ‘There was an imbalance of power in the group’. Each item was investigated separately."

measured_by: single-item rating of agreement with the objective of one’s role
justification: "Participants rated: (1) their agreement with the objective of their role … Each rating was provided on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 7 (very much)."

measured_by: single-item rating of how stressful they found the group activity
justification: "Participants rated … (2) how stressful they found the group activity … on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 7 (very much)."

measured_by: single-item rating of how valuable they found the group activity
justification: "Participants rated … (3) how valuable they found the group activity … on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 7 (very much)."

measured_by: single-item rating of how seriously they took the exercise
justification: "Participants rated … (4) how seriously they took the exercise. Each rating was provided on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 7 (very much)."

measured_by: composite of three self-report questions about role in decision making, overall participation, and vocalness
justification: "We created a compound variable by averaging responses to … (1) ‘How much of a role did you play in the final decision making?’ (2) ‘Overall, how much did you participate in the exercise?’ and (3) ‘Were you as vocal as you would have liked to be?’ … This composite had good reliability."
